posts.name: Sean
posts.cooked: It has the 1.2.1 firmware on it if I remember correctly. every time I upload latest release and have the checksum in correctly I press the update button, and nothing happens. The button turns white for 2 seconds and goes back to blue. Any insight would be appreciated, I tryed both versions of the latest release.

posts.name: David
posts.cooked: Have you tried doing a Power Cycle? (turning the radio off and turn it back on)

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
Also: are you using the right firmware version?

There is one set of firmware and SHA keys for radios before 1.2.0 and a different set (both file download and key), for radios at greater than 1.2.x.

Any screenshots you can post as well??

posts.name: David
posts.cooked:
In addition to what Jwal said, You can see the current version by opening the radio’s URL and doing /status

It will open a json and at the bottom of the json there should be a “Version”

posts.name: Sean
Kiet Chau
posts.cooked:
Skimonster110:

The button turns white for 2 seconds and goes back to blue. Any insight would be appreciated, I tryed both versions of the latest release.

I think you’re using the wrong file and/or wrong checksum.

posts.name: Fletcher
posts.cooked: Can you post a screenshot of the /status page as well as the file name of the firmware you are trying to install.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.

posts.custom_user_title: FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.

posts.name: David
posts.cooked:
Its seems like you are using the wrong firmware. You use the 1.2.8 firmware that’s for radios which are now at version 1.2.X Your radio is 1.1.2 You should use the “regular” version.

VH-109_1.2.8-01222025.img.enc

posts.name: Sean
posts.cooked: Ive had the same issue with that version in the past but I will try it again Monday.
